statement:
A multinomial is a mathematical expression consisting of two or more
terms, e.g. $$a_1 x_1 + a_2 x_2 + \ldots + a_k x_k.$$ The multinomial
theorem provides the general form of the expansion of the powers of this
expression, in the process specifying the multinomial coefficients which
are found in that expansion. The expansion is:
$$(x_1 + x_2 + \ldots + x_k)^n =
\sum \frac{n!}{n_1! n_2! \dotsb n_k!} x_1^{n_1} x_2^{n_2} \cdots x_k^{n_k}$$
where the sum is taken over all multi-indices
$(n_1, \ldots n_k)\in\mathbb{N}^k$ that sum to $n$.

The expression $\frac{n!}{n_1! n_2! \cdots n_k!}$ occurring in the
expansion is called *multinomial coefficient* and is denoted by
$$\binom{n}{n_1, n_2, \dotsc, n_k}.$$
